data.description:
Time is 1337-reverse so 1337 again to get the time!

Watch requirement: Leet-speak skills. 

Also enjoy discovering 4-letter words inside the time.

Samples:
1) 13:37 = LEET
2) 14:20 = LAZO
3) 22:22 = ZZZZ (time to sleep?)

Leet speak:
O = 0 
L = 1 
Z = 2 
E = 3 
A = 4 
S = 5 
G = 6 
T = 7 
B = 8 
P = 9
data.title: Reverse 1337

data.description:
Fuzzy Time based on Fuzzy Text International with timetable extension.
Shows battery status.
Shows battery status of phone (Android 6, maybe 5, otherwise you need a small server on your phone, wich you find on github).
Shows difference from exact time (minutes).
Data Mode: not fuzzy, shows exact time,
You can configure a TimeTable: For each day you note the time-interval of your entries and you will be warned if you have 5 minutes to your lessen.

changelog.release_notes: upgraded for new os.
added round support
Added all 64 colors from 8 colors
Fixed font problem with day of the week
Big bug fix on communication with phone. Battery is much better now. Also bug fix for seconds changing fonts. Also put in color code for pebble time. Will put in store with color once store is ready.
Made changes for sdk 3.0 release.
Changed weather providers again. I also had bug fixes. Instead of location the app now tells you tomorrow's high and low temperature.
fixed timeout bug on getting information from phone. Also made improvement on watch battery usage.
I needed to change weather providers. I reached the daily limit to quickly with the one I was using.

data.description:
The time is told in an analogue style on a 3D effect disc, a bit like a ventilated brake disc. The blocks inside the diagonal slots turn off incrementally to display the current time.

The hours are on the inner ring of slots (red) and the 5-minutes on the outer ring (cyan).  The inner slots that display the hours are in the traditional analogue position.  Following the line of the slots outward gives the 5-minute for that position.  A little bit tricky, but you soon get used to it.

The additional 4 single minutes are in the screw-like holes top, bottom, left and right, starting at the top.  

2 final points to note: 
- At midday (12:00) all blocks are on
- At midnight (00:00) all 5-minute blocks on, all hour blocks off

Screenshots:
 (1)   6:13 
 (2)   8:44
 (3) 12:00
 (4) 00:00
 (5)   3:34 (with Quick View)

Design from Peter Fletcher, from the UK.  The watchface has been co-developed with the designer and is published with the designer's permission.

latest_release.release_notes: Adds support for Pebble firmware v4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
UPDATE 3: Now counts down the "X Hrs. to" countdown on the homepage! To follow along with the Kickstarter Campaign, download "Kickstarter Countdown".

UPDATE 2: This was for the initial countdown to what turned out to be the Pebble Time Kickstarter campaign. To follow along with that, download my other watchface "Kickstarter Countdown".

I don't know what Team Pebble is counting down to, but I bet it'll be exciting! Track the countdown featured on GetPebble.com right on your wrist!!!

UPDATE: If you are not located in the EST timezone, please click the Website Link below to get the proper PBW file. Sorry for the hackiness of this workaround, but there isn't enough time to bundle JavaScript into the watchface.

Give a Heart if you can't wait to see what Pebble has in store for us!!!
data.title: GetPebble Countdown

changelog.release_notes:
*TripTime is now Out of Support*
Thanks to everyone making this an awesome journey. Weather is not free to everyone. Google API quota is now public and can be overloaded based on the number of request per day; if it fails please try again in a while.
Special thanks to everybody supporting the project. You are simply the best.
- Fix Yahoo Weather geolocation

- Add PTR compatibility
- Fix weather images on B&W devices

- Add support to Pebble Time
- Bypass the Yahoo! Weather bug on GPS.

- Fix the time size issue
- Enable temperature on Farenheith
Proudly announcing TripTime

data.description: Now supports - Spanish, French and German. Displays local and dual date and time; forget about timezones and daylight saving, TripTime do all for you. Support the project to unlock weather info! Spanish Muestra la fecha y hora en local y dual; olvídate de los husos horarios y horarios de verano, TripTime lo hace todo por ti. ¡Colabora con el proyecto para desbloquear la información metereológica! French Affiche la date et l'heure locale et le double; oublier les fuseaux horaires et l'heure d'été, TripTime faire tout pour vous. Soutenir le projet pour débloquer info météo! German Zeigt lokale und Dual Datum und Uhrzeit; vergessen Sie über Zeitzonen und Sommerzeit, TripTime tun alles für Sie. Unterstützen Sie das Projekt, um Wetterinformationen freizuschalten!

latest_release.release_notes:
*TripTime is now Out of Support*
Thanks to everyone making this an awesome journey. Weather is not free to everyone. Google API quota is now public and can be overloaded based on the number of request per day; if it fails please try again in a while.
Special thanks to everybody supporting the project. You are simply the best.

data.description:
This watchface is a tribute to "4Cells Original" that comes with Canvas for Pebble. I wanted to make a watchface that would load quickly on the watch, which was not the case with the Canvas watchface.
The 4 tabs of the original watchface were retained: Date with day of the week, Weather with location and icon, Battery status (only watch) and BT connection, and Time.

v1.3 - Fixed date not showing correctly for 1-9
v1.2 - Added settings page - GPS or user selected location and °C/°F. Time is still only 24hrs format.

data.description:
A mountain inspired watchface  

This is the version of the watchface without an airplane as seconds display. This version is designed to go easy on the battery.
For the one with seconds, check out my other watchface Panoramic.

A beautiful (imho) and functional watchface, showing a panoramic view of Mountains. I designed the watchface to be minimal, but still include all the function I need on a daily basis like the date and weekday.  The watchface includes bluetooth disconnect notification, by vibrating twice when the watch loses the connection and vibrating once when the phone is connected again.  

If you like the watchface, please heart it.

data.description:
MetroWeather watchface displays time, date and weather information in a nice and clean metro design. 

Features:
- Automatic Localization for English, French, German, Spanish and Chinese.
- Degrees in °C. 
- textual and graphical conditions
- Date and Time
- Battery Status in percent
     examples: normal "60%"; loading ">70%"; fully charged ">|100%"
- Weather Icons show now a moon instead of a sun at night time 
     (between 6pm and 6am)
- Timeline enabled

Weather Icons are from meteocons font (http://www.alessioatzeni.com/meteocons/).

changelog.release_notes: Changed to Clay configuration screens - will work when phone is offline
Adds support for Pebble 2.  No change for Quick Views as these do not obscure the time telling section.
Added support for color and round Pebbles.  Configuration for color choices and, for b&w watches, inverting colors.  Required pebble firmware 3.8+

data.description:
The time is told by four concentric digits which wrap around the center of the display. 
The right-hand side of the digit is at the top, slightly left of center, and the left-hand side at the other end of the ring, slightly right of center. 
The digits are read from outside in - the outer two digits are the hours and the inner two are the minutes.
The digits are hidden in plain view and look cryptic to those unfamiliar with it, but will be clear as day to the initiated.

Time displayed in 12 or 24 hour mode, depending on watch settings.
  
Configuration options allow choice of number colors and white or black backgrounds.   

Screenshots show:  
  02:58, 09:36, 14:45

Design created by Peter Fletcher, from UK, and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   This watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/01/03/digital-warp-lcd-watch-replicates-a-black-hole-on-your-wrist/

latest_release.release_notes: Changed to Clay configuration screens - will work when phone is offline

data.title: Digital Warp

data.author: Omeed R.

changelog.release_notes: Fixed bug where if you disabled location services for the pebble, the "Loading..." sign would be stuck on the watchface screen.

This update brings with it weather information along the top of the watchface. 
Currently it only supports Fahrenheit.
It gives the current temperature, daily low, and daily high. Ensure location services is enabled for the pebble app in order for the weather functionality to work. 
The weather information only refreshes when you change the screen manually so as to avoid excessive battery usage.
Initial release. Version 1.0.

data.description:
Similar to the stock watchface, this face displays the date and the time in a concise manner. It also displays an abbreviation for the day of the week in front of the abbreviated month name. 

Update 1.1: This update brings with it weather information along the top of the watchface. Currently it only supports Fahrenheit. It gives the current temperature, daily low, and daily high. Ensure location services is enabled for the pebble app in order for the weather functionality to work. If you don't want the weather information you can disable location services for the pebble app to turn them off. Settings are currently not available, sorry. The weather information only refreshes when you change the screen manually so as to avoid excessive battery usage.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed bug where if you disabled location services for the pebble, the "Loading..." sign would be stuck on the watchface screen.

data.title: Concise Date, Time, Temperature

data.description:
The time is told by the asymmetric array of shapes. 
The hours are displayed as digits.   The minutes in 5-minute shapes in the analogue positions along with four single minutes in a vertical column just inside these on the left hand side.   If the hour has "lit up" where the 5-minute shape needs to appear, the "light" is switched off.

The PM indicator appears in the triangle on the right side.
  
Configurable options:
- Midnight hour can be set to 0 or 12.
- Color of the shapes
  
Screenshots show:  
(1)   3:15PM 
(2) 10:45AM
(3)   8:21PM
(4) 12:04PM (with Quick View)

Design created by Peter Fletcher originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/06/13/asymmetric-led-watch-is-a-cryptic-fusion-of-analogue-digital/

latest_release.release_notes: Restored menu icon lost in last CloudPebble build

data.title: Asymmetric

data.description:
A mountain inspired watchface

If you want a version without the seconds animation, check out my other watchface, Panoramic lite.

A beautiful (imho) and functional watchface, showing a panoramic view of Mountains. The airplane represents the seconds, flying from left to right in one minute. I designed the watchface to be minimal, but still include all the function I need on a daily basis like the date and seconds.

The watchface includes bluetooth disconnect notification, by vibrating twice when the watch loses the connection and vibrating once when the phone is connected again.

If you like the watchface, please heart it.

data.description: Another analog face for my fourth offering. This is minimalist, and it's the first that would be a bit tricky to do in a physical mechanism. A single hand shows the minute, while the hour is displayed (in analog or digital form) in a secondary face attached to the minute hand.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.1: Corrected display of 12-o'clock hour in 12-hour mode. Adjusted positioning of digital hour display. Updated layout to support Pebble Time Round.

data.author: David Stosik

changelog.release_notes: Port to SDK 3.

# v2.0 : add extras and settings

This version adds a few extras and settings to the watch face.

- Center the watch face on the Pebble Steel's frame.
- Notify Bluetooth disconnect (vibration and/or screen inversion).
- Vibrate every hour

# First official release

Still a lot to do, but this version is usable as a simple watch face.

data.description:
A watch face inspired of the famous Rorschach test ink blots.

The watch face gets its desired look by giving digits a fat, round font, mirroring them, then melting them together.

When idle, hours are displayed on the top right part while minutes are on the bottom left part of the watch face. Depending on your display mode, digits can be mirrored, then melted together.

This watch face is inspired of Sam Jerichow's Rorschach 2 watch concept:
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/03/14/rorschach-2-e-paper-watch-update/

You can buy an original Kisai Rorschach e-paper watch here: http://www.tokyoflash.com/en/watches/kisai/rorschach/

More details: http://dstosik.github.io/pebblot
data.title: Inkblot

changelog.release_notes:
- Battery and Bluetooth status now displayed within Blue Sun hieroglyph
- Battery status only displayed when it's <20% or watch plugged in

data.description:
"Two by two, hands of blue". This watchface displays date and time with the logo of beloved Blue Sun corporation in the background.

Shake your watch to display random quote from Firefly series or Serenity movie (your Pebble holds almost 500 quotes for endless entertainment). Shake the watch again to return back to time.

Quotes database, graciously provided by Bill Hatcher from his online generator at http://cubemonkey.net/quotes/

latest_release.release_notes:
- Battery and Bluetooth status now displayed within Blue Sun hieroglyph
- Battery status only displayed when it's <20% or watch plugged in
- Only horizontal shake is detected to display quote, to prevent accidental display - Fixed minor memory leak

data.title: Blue Sun Quotes

data.author: TOPRAK
data.description:
The signature of great Turkish leader Mustafa Kemal ATATURK. 

He was a Turkish army officer, reformist statesman, and the first President of Turkey. He is credited with being the founder of the Republic of Turkey.

Turkish:

Büyük lider Mustafa Kemal' in imzasıdır.

Türk içeriğin az olması dikkatimi çekti. Bu ilk saat arayüzü denemem. Beğendiyseniz lütfen "beğen" butonuna tıklayın.
data.title: Atatürk's Signature

data.author: Dan Sherbeck

changelog.release_notes:
- Added health steps and distance that can be displayed in 5 formats.
- Changes were made to the UI to accommodate the step count & distance, particularly with centering weather.
- Removed option for rounded vs. square digits. Now digits always have rounded corners.
- Removed option for centered vs. fixed time in 12-hour mode. Now time is always centered.
- Removed some of the animations when the watchface is first launched thereby showing the time faster.
- Fixed a bug where the 3-day forecast for Forecast.io would show yesterday's forecast. Most noticeable in GMT+ timezones.

- Forecast.io weather
- Real temp (Forecast.io), wind chill (Yahoo)
- Elevation

- Yahoo weather fix (again).
- Update display every second ONLY if custom date format contains seconds.

- 3-day forecast in Italian, Portuguese, and Russian.
- Bug fix: Weather updates would stop after a Bluetooth disconnect/reconnect.
Large battery percent and minor bug fixes.
Center weather now an option, large battery icon option (square screens only), show Bluetooth disconnect message option, small spacing changes on Round, settings page layout changes
Moved square and circle patterns so they don't bisect temperature.
GPS fix, center time, center weather, custom date, hour vibrate, forecast display speed, forecast backlight, remove AM/PM
Pebble Round support. Weather update interval selection (15, 30, 60 minutes) for Pebble Time/Steel and Round.

- Yahoo! weather with 3-day forecast
- Four new preconfigured color themes
- A handful of minor new features
Fix for Settings showing blank, white screen on iOS
Quiet hours, create and save up to 8 custom color palettes, create and save up to 8 custom themes.
More color themes, date wraps to 2 lines, new date format, animation tweaks on Time, ISO date workaround with Time FW v3.3, minor bug fixes.
Rotate theme feature, larger date font option, changed some default settings
Smoother animations especially on Time.
Battery Saver feature and choose background color for pattern
Bug fix for date auto-hiding
Error handling around launching Settings on Time.
Animations more Pebble-like.
Wider pattern lines, new color menu icons, minor tweaks

data.description:
Health, weather, and date accented with exploding digits. Select any combination of colors to match your mood, favorite sports team, your outfit, the season, etc. Bluetooth alerts, battery level, themes, battery saving features, plus more.

v3.87 - Added health steps and distance, made UI adjustments to accommodate health. Go to Implode Settings to configure.

Open Settings for:
• Yahoo! or Forecast.io weather with 3-day forecast, wind chill/real temp, and elevation
• Unlimited date formats - 29 preconfigured or enter your own
• Date & weather in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, and Russian (3-day forecast only)
• Battery level percent and/or icon
• Hourly vibrate
• Vibrate patterns for Bluetooth connect/disconnect
• Up to 8 custom themes
• Automatically change themes periodically
• Battery Saver - Disable animations after a duration you specify
• Quiet Hours - Disable animations, weather updates, and vibrate alerts during specified hours
• ...plus more!

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added health steps and distance that can be displayed in 5 formats.
- Changes were made to the UI to accommodate the step count & distance, particularly with centering weather.
- Removed option for rounded vs. square digits. Now digits always have rounded corners.
- Removed option for centered vs. fixed time in 12-hour mode. Now time is always centered.
- Removed some of the animations when the watchface is first launched thereby showing the time faster.
- Fixed a bug where the 3-day forecast for Forecast.io would show yesterday's forecast. Most noticeable in GMT+ timezones.

data.title: Implode

Nearly on the hour fix.
At nearly on the hour, blank lines would appear between "nearly" and [hour]. This has, now, been fixed.
Note: Version 0.13 was never released.
Fixed issue with time on the hour (X o'clock).
Fixed issues with midnight calculation.

First published version.
Might have bugs.

data.description:
When they ask you "What's the time?", you don't say "one twenty three". Do you?
Well, I say: "nearly twenty five past one".
This is what this watchface does. It shows the time as if you were saying it.

latest_release.release_notes:
Nearly on the hour fix.
At nearly on the hour, blank lines would appear between "nearly" and [hour]. This has, now, been fixed.
Note: Version 0.13 was never released.

data.description:
Analog style watch displayed on two faces of a cube with battery level and bluetooth connectivity shown on the third (left hand) face.  
Hours and 5-minutes appear as blank cells arranged around the top and right faces of the cube, respectively, in analog fashion starting with 0 in the highest cell. 
4 additional minutes are shown with the cells in the middle of the right face disappearing.
The middle large cell on the top face is the PM indicator (not present in the morning).

The battery level decreases every 10% drop.   

3 screenshots:  
(1)   8:10PM, battery 100%, bluetooth connected 
(2)   3:46PM, battery 10%, bluetooth connected
(3) 11:34AM, battery 70%, no bluetooth

The last two images are not screenshots, but show how to read the time.

Design created by Peter Fletcher and orinigally appeared onthe Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/03/13/anacube-a-geometric-analogue-style-lcd-watch/

latest_release.release_notes: Restored menu icon lost in last CloudPebble build

data.title: Anacube

data.description:
Pokétch+

Pokétch+ is a fork of Pokétch Digital - a Pebble watchface designed to emulate the digital watchface used on the Pokétch watch in Pokémon Diamond/Pearl/Platinum.

Added Features:
- Pebble Round support
- Pebble Time color support
- Color inversion for day/night
- Date
- Battery bar on lower right
- Pikachu charging image when watch is charging
- "!" to left of Pikachu when bluetooth disconnected
- Vibrate when bluetooth disconnected
data.title: Pokétch+

data.author: BigKegs

changelog.release_notes: This version resolves an issue with the config page. Now relocated onto a different server to preserver 24-7 access.
Native Pebble Time Support
Fixed API problem with weather data.

Major new release. You'll find a brand new font "Tall"! Don't worry you can always use the original layout if you prefer from the settings page. Don't forget to relaunch the watch face if you choose the new font.
A small bug fix

Changed 'Clear' to 'Sunny' during day hours 8am-8pm

Removed preceding '0' from 12hr time, am time will now read '8:00' instead of '08:00'
Increased font sizes for better visibility and maximum time size.
Bug fixes on weather collation and location. Thanks for informing me so quickly.
Time outs changed for location finding. Increased so phone can take longer to locate position.
Added option to toggle between Celsius and Fahrenheit (ºC / ºF)
Added option to invert the clock face. Enjoy.
version 1. Just getting started.

data.description:
Desk Clock is a simple digital watch face with local weather and date. Based upon a simple clean desk clock. Full functions include:

- Invert the Colour of the Watch Face

- New "Tall" Font Alternative Watch Face

- Local Weather (Cloudy, 4ºC / Cloudy, 41ºF)

- Choose Celsius or Fahrenheit

- Date (Tue, 10 Feb 15)

- Battery Status ('.....' below time)

- Bluetooth Disconnect ('.' above time)

- Bluetooth Disconnect Notification (vibration alert)

Visit my website for further information.

latest_release.release_notes: This version resolves an issue with the config page. Now relocated onto a different server to preserver 24-7 access.

data.title: Desk Clock

data.author: Theo

changelog.release_notes:
-Version 1.0: We Did It-
Hey guys! Happy to say we're finally at our 1.0 release! I've been working hard on adding customization options to inSquare and splitSquare, and now they're all a single watchface! There is also now a toggle for vibrating on BT disconnect, so we'll alert you when you've went too far from your phone.

Check out our blog at inSquare.Theo.website for more exciting news on inSquare and our coming Pebble Time version: inColor!
Version 0.2, this one looks notably better with a thicker font on top than on botton
Version 0.1, still kind of surprised it works honestly.

data.description: inSquare is a uniquely minimal watchface designed for the Pebble and Pebble Steel. A simple square with the numbered time inside, inSquare takes the minimalist digital concept and makes it elegant. With a simple customization page allowing for 3 different, unqiue modes, as well as a "vibrate on disconnect" toggle, inSquare is a great option for your wrist. And of course, inSquare is open source, with all of the code immediately available and well documented on GitHub

latest_release.release_notes:
-Version 1.0: We Did It-
Hey guys! Happy to say we're finally at our 1.0 release! I've been working hard on adding customization options to inSquare and splitSquare, and now they're all a single watchface! There is also now a toggle for vibrating on BT disconnect, so we'll alert you when you've went too far from your phone.

Check out our blog at inSquare.Theo.website for more exciting news on inSquare and our coming Pebble Time version: inColor!

data.title: inSquare

data.description:
Based off the Nintendo classic Final Fantasy 3. 

Features include:

-Heroes-
Choose what heroes you'd like to adventure with.

-Levels-
Levels are gained based on the difficulty mode you choose.

Easy is 500 steps per level.
Normal is 2,000 steps per level.
Hard is 5,000 steps per level.
Insane is 10,000 steps per level.

-Experience (Steps)-
You gain experience for every step you take.

-HP (Battery Life)-
Your heroes HP will diminish as your battery loses charge, make sure they don't die!

-MP (Date)-
Your MP will provide the current day and month.

Want more of a challenge?
Setup Auto Reset which will reset your level and experience daily, weekly, or monthly.

That experience not adding up to your liking?
Try out the Sensitivity option to raise that step sensitivity.

I hope you enjoy this watchface, if you did please add a heart.

-Game Time
data.title: Final Fantasy GT

data.description:
A watch face whose hour hand looks different from the minute hand to avoid misreading the time.

The hands are aesthetically round and pleasing to the eye.

Watch face has the following complications:

- Day of week and day of month
- Battery level (only shows when under 30% or charging)
- Bluetooth indicator shows BT when disconnected and also vibrates
- Weather icon (sun, cloudy, rain, thunder, haze)
- High/low daily temperature (Celsius or Fahrenheit)
- Sunrise/sunset time

Watch also has these additional features:

- Specify the time frame when weather data should be fetched/updated (default is to update after midnight)
- Specify how often to update (every X hours)
- Shows tomorrow's weather after 9pm (configurable)
- Optional white background

To use the weather data, you need to know your latitude and longitude, which you can find using the included Google Map interface.
data.title: Orbit II Square

data.description:
The watch hands are aesthetically round and pleasing to the eye and readable from afar. Enjoy this contemporary classical analog time piece with your friends and co-workers. Inspired by the Japanese art of zen gardens, which are round and peaceful.

Watch face has the following complications:

- Bottom/Right - Day of Month - with a meter that marks down the last 7 days of the month

- Bottom/Left - Day of Week - with a meter that marks the 7 days of the week

- Top/Left - Time in digital format

- Top/Right - Battery life - with a meter that counts down the battery life

You can hide any or all of the 4 complications for a minimal look.

Watch also has the following features:

- When bluetooth is disconnected, the watch vibrates and shows the bluetooth icon in the center.

- You can customize whether to show or hide the "12" and "6" o'clock digits and whether to use a white background.

- Optional second hand can be enabled in the settings and can be hidden during night time to save battery.
data.title: Orbit

data.description:
This is a digital clock using Roman numerals.

Hours
Minutes
Seconds

It also displays the Roman day name and the date from a Julian calendar. 

Beware the Ides of March!

You can find out about the Julian dates here http://www.unrv.com/culture/julian-calendar-chart.php

I'm not quite sure why I made this, but it's been on my todo list for ages :)

Let me know if you like it and if I get enough feedback I'll add a load of funky settings.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed a couple of bugs with 12 and 0

data.description:
This Watchface displays the hours, minutes and seconds as numbers that will be moving down the screen every time they are increased, until they go back to 0, and start from the top again.

It shows a nice way of noticing how late are we in this day by looking at the hour position, how late we are in this hour by looking at the minute position, and the same with the current minute when checking the seconds.
